newsitem.title: UK: ONE BRENT CARGO KEPT, ONE FIVE O'CLOCKED - TRADE.
newsitem.headline: ONE BRENT CARGO KEPT, ONE FIVE O'CLOCKED - TRADE.

text.p: One of the two Brent cargoes due to turn wet on Monday was kept ahead of the five o'clock deadline, while the second was clocked to a refiner, traders said.
The cargoes, due to load August 26-28, were kept by British Petroleum and clocked to Spanish refiner Repsol.
Brent cargoes are traded on a paper, or forward market, until the 1700 London time deadline on the nearest trading day 15 days before their assigned loading date.
A trading company is clocked when it is left with a paper cargo which has turned physical after that deadline and therefore cannot be passed on as part of pre-sold paper cargo deals.
